intro: Belonophora talbotii, commonly known as the talbot's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are characterized by their blue or violet coloration and tubular shape, which attracts pollinators like bees and butterflies. Belonophora talbotii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
